content:
http://backdrop-live.backdropcms.org/

We got the sub-domain working. I'll get SSL working later today.

@jenlampton and I spoke today. We're going to just rely on Eventbrite for registration and collect topic ideas during registration. I'll be turning off the "submit a session/topic" option on the site for now.

For now, users won't be creating account on the event site. They will register for Eventbrite and we'll import the registrations into our event site later and automatically create accounts for people that have registered (probably - we're still working out the details).
Hoping to get the event site and registration live by Wednesday. Maybe as early as tomorrow.
So does that mean that the sessions that are currently listed on the website are not valid?
We will keep this list and make use of it. Maybe create a page of "possible topics."
But, when we go live, this specific schedule will go away and we'll start building a new one based upon input from registrations.
